text: 父を憎んでいたのか好きだったのか / ただ一つはっきりとしているのは
translation: Whether I hated my father or loved him... The one thing that's clear is...
grammar: The ~のか...のか pattern expresses uncertainty between two possibilities, similar to 'whether... or...'

text: セカンドインパクトを起こした使徒を倒す / そのためにネルフへ入ったわ
translation: To defeat the Angels that caused Second Impact - that's why I joined NERV.
grammar: そのために (for that purpose) connects a goal to an action taken to achieve it.

text: 結局私はただ父への復讐を果たしたいだけなのかもしれない
translation: In the end, maybe I just want to fulfill my revenge against my father.
grammar: ~たいだけなのかもしれない combines desire (~たい), limitation (だけ), and speculation (かもしれない).

text: 父の呪縛から逃れるために / 逃げちゃダメだ逃げちゃダメだ
translation: To escape from my father's curse... I mustn't run away, I mustn't run away.
grammar: ~ちゃダメだ is casual prohibition (contraction of ~てはダメだ), meaning 'must not'.

text: そう逃げちゃダメだ / 目標を最大望遠で確認 / 距離およそ25000 / おいでなすったわね
translation: That's right, I mustn't run away. / Target confirmed at maximum zoom. / Distance approximately 25,000. / So it's arrived.
grammar: おいでなすった is an archaic/formal honorific past tense of 'to come', used sarcastically here.

text: エヴァ前期スタート1
translation: Eva, first phase start!
grammar: Military/technical command structure using borrowed English 'start' with Japanese numbering.

text: 第1回 第1
translation: Round 1, Number 1!
grammar: 第 + number creates ordinal numbers (first, second, etc.).

text: 距離!一番二千!
translation: Distance! Unit One, 2000!
grammar: Abbreviated military communication style, dropping particles for speed.

text: フィールドゼッカイ!
translation: Field at maximum!
grammar: Technical command combining 'field' (AT Field) with Japanese 絶界 (absolute limit).

text: 動き!フィールド全開! / やってるわよ!
translation: Move! Field fully open! / I'm doing it!
grammar: やってるわよ uses the feminine sentence-final particle わよ for emphasis/assertion.

text: 今だ!
translation: Now!
grammar: 今だ is an emphatic expression meaning 'now is the time!' - だ adds assertion.

text: 電波システム回復 / 南極の碇司令から通信が入ってます
translation: Radio systems recovered. / Incoming transmission from Commander Ikari in Antarctica.
grammar: ~が入っています indicates something is coming in/being received (formal report style).

text: おつなぎして / はい
translation: Connect me. / Yes.
grammar: お + verb stem + して is a polite request form (honorific prefix お).

text: 申し訳ありません / 私の勝手な判断で初号機を破損してしまいました
translation: I apologize. Due to my own arbitrary judgment, Unit 01 was damaged.
grammar: ~てしまいました expresses regret about a completed action (unfortunate result).

text: 責任は全て私にあります / かまわん 死と殲滅がエヴァの使命だ / その程度の被害はむしろ幸運と言える / よくやってくれた 桂木さんさ
translation: All responsibility lies with me. / It doesn't matter. Fighting Angels is Eva's mission. / That level of damage could rather be called fortunate. / Well done, Major Katsuragi.
grammar: かまわん is a masculine/authoritative form of かまわない (doesn't matter).

text: ありがとうございます / ところで初号機のパイロットはいるか
translation: Thank you. / By the way, is Unit 01's pilot there?
grammar: いるか is a direct/masculine question form (without the polite ですか).

text: はい / 話は聞いた よくやったな シンジ
translation: Yes. / I heard the report. Well done, Shinji.
grammar: よくやったな is praise with the masculine/casual sentence-final particle な.

text: はい / では桂木さんさ 後の処理は任せる
translation: Yes. / Then Major Katsuragi, I leave the aftermath handling to you.
grammar: 任せる without を marks the speaker's authority - 'I entrust (this) to you'.

text: はい
translation: Yes.
grammar: Simple affirmative response, showing deference to a superior.

text: 新宮の下 / 新宮の下 / さあ約 / 束は守ってもらうわよ / はいはい / タイマイを下ろしてきたから / フルコースだって耐えられるわよ
translation: Below the shrine... / Below the shrine... / Now then, you're going to keep your promise! / Yes, yes. / I withdrew my savings, so I can handle even a full course meal!
grammar: ~てもらうわよ is a strong assertion that the speaker expects the action to be done for them.

text: 給料前だけどね
translation: Even though it's before payday.
grammar: ~だけどね adds a softening/explanatory tone, acknowledging a contradiction.

text: ミサトの財布の中身くらい分かってるわ / 無理しなくていいわよ
translation: I know at least what's in Misato's wallet. / You don't have to push yourself.
grammar: ~くらい indicates 'at least' or 'to that extent' - showing familiarity with the situation.

text: 優等生もラーメンなら付き合うって言うしさ / 私ニンニクラーメンチャーシュー抜き / 私はフカヒレチャーシュー大盛りね / はいフカヒレチャーシューお待ち
translation: The honor student said she'd come along if it's ramen. / I'll have garlic ramen without char siu. / I'll have shark fin with char siu, large serving. / Here's the shark fin char siu, thanks for waiting.
grammar: ~なら (if it's ~) sets a condition; 抜き and 大盛り are common food ordering terms.

text: ねえミサトさん / 何 / さっき父さんの言葉を聞いて褒められることが嬉しいって
translation: Hey, Misato-san. / What? / Hearing my father's words earlier, I realized that being praised makes me happy...
grammar: 褒められること (being praised) is a nominalized passive form - the action of being praised becomes a noun.

text: 初めて分かってんわ気がする
translation: I feel like I understand for the first time.
grammar: 気がする expresses a subjective feeling or intuition about something.

text: それに分かったんだ / 僕は父さんのさっきの言葉を聞きたくて
translation: And I realized... I wanted to hear those words from my father just now.
grammar: ~たくて expresses a reason/cause based on wanting to do something (te-form of ~たい).

text: シュミレーションプラグの実験中に起こった事件 / 地下施設ついに自爆決議を迫られるネルフ / 次回首都侵入 / この次もサービスサービス
translation: An incident that occurred during simulation plug experiments. / NERV is finally forced to make a self-destruct resolution for the underground facility. / Next episode: Capital Invasion. / More fan service next time too!
grammar: 迫られる is the passive of 迫る (to press/force), meaning 'to be forced/pressured into'.
